title: [const_generics] Passing unsafe function outside `impl` crashes

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly

body:
### Code https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=c5d3a3135d1f5f27de7dd26bfdae9f7a ```Rust #![feature(const_generics)] #![feature(const_compare_raw_pointers)] struct Test(*const usize); type PassArg = (); unsafe extern "C" fn pass(args: PassArg) { println!("Hello, world!"); } impl Test { pub fn call_me(&self) { self.0 = Self::trampiline:: as _ } unsafe extern "C" fn trampiline< Args: Sized, const IDX: usize, const FN: unsafe extern "C" fn(Args), >( args: Args, ) { FN(args) } } fn main() { let x = Test(); x.call_me::() } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` 1.44.0-nightly 2020-04-20 20fc02f836f3035b86b5 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_middle/ty/subst.rs:573: type parameter `Args/#0` (Args/0) out of range when substituting (root type=Some(unsafe extern "C" fn(Args))) substs=[] ```
